#Text=Hatem Beg Ordubadi
#Text=Hatem
#Text=" Beg " Ordubadi
#Text=(
#Text=Persian
#Text=: حاتم بیگ اردوبادی‎ ) , was an Iranian aristocrat from the Ordubadi family , who served as the grand vizier of the Safavid king ( shah ) Abbas I ( r. 1588 – 1629 ) from 1591 to 1610/1 .
#Text=Biography
#Text=Background and early life

#Text=Hatem was the son of Bahram Khan Ordubadi , the lord of Ordubad , the homeland of the Ordubadi family — an Iranian family which was descended from the medieval philosopher and polymath Nasir al-Din al-Tusi . [ 1 ]
#Text=Hatem later succeeded his father as the lord of Urdubad , and received the title of " Beg " ( lord ) . [ 2 ] [ upper-alpha 1 ]

column1: #Text=Due to local disagreements , he resigned however , and went to the royal court .
#Text=In the ensuing period he served as vizier of the governor of Khoy . [ 3 ]
#Text=However , when the latter was dismissed later on , Hatem Beg lost his job as well , and settled again in Ordubad and later Ardabil . [ 3 ]

#Text=His fortunes changed in the early rule of Abbas I , when he was appointed as the vizier of the governor of Kerman , Vali Beg Yuz Bashi Afshar and was later made the accountant ( mostowfi al-mamalek ) of Yazd . [ 3 ]
#Text=Vizierate under Shah Abbas I

#Text=In 1587-1588 , Hatem 's brother Abu Taleb Beg , then the mostowfi al-mamalek was sent as an envoy to the ruler of the Uzbeks , Abdullah Khan II , who was trying to take Herat from the Safavids at the time . [ 4 ]
#Text=Abdullah Khan II was not interested in negotiations , and had Abu Taleb Beg executed by putting him in front of the mouth of a cannon . [ 4 ]

#Text=As a result of this gruesome tale in relation to his close relative , Hatem Beg was taken under Abbas I 's wings , and in 1591 , he appointed him as the mostowfi al-mamalek of all of Iran , while six months later he made him his grand vizier . [ 5 ] [ 4 ]

#Text=Hatem Beg , who became known by his honorific of Etemad-e daulat ( " Trusty Support of the State " ) , which was given to every Safavid grand vizier , demonstrated to be a statesman of noteworthy capacity during his tenure as grand vizier . [ 6 ]
#Text=During his tenure he managed to form a highly potent state administration that allowed the country to persist to prosper under considerably less adept shahs after Abbas I 's death . [ 6 ]

#Text=The Safavid court historian Iskandar Beg Munshi , who was attached to the retinue of Hatem Beg , states that he " brought security into the lives of Iranians " and " was a model for all in regard to the administration of justice , his knowledge of accounting procedures , and his organisation of divan affairs .

#Text=It was unusual for a person of Iranian stock to be involved in military affairs — the Iranian statesman Mirza Salman Jaberi , who had served as grand vizier from 1577 to 1583 , had as a result of his involvement in military affairs made the Qizilbash hostile towards him , who felt that their power had been usurped .

#Text=Hatem Beg 's involvement in military affairs , however , did not arouse the antagonism of the Qizilbash , which , in the words of David Blow , was  a sign of changing times " . [ 6 ]

column1: #Text=In 1594/5 , Hatem Beg , together with a group of administrators and accountants , were sent to the newly subdued province of Gilan , where they improved the structure of tax charge and contribution , which , supposedly , was done at the demand of the residents who were discontent with the oppressive governorship of Mehdi Qoli Khan Shamlu . [ 7 ]

#Text=More likely , however , this reform took place due to the economic capability the province offered — its rich silk manufacture , tea , caviar , and lumber encouraged Abbas I to dispatch his most prominent officers to overhaul the economic system of the province in a just approach . [ 7 ]
#Text=Death and offspring
#Text=Hatem Beg died in 1610/1 near Urmia during an expedition [ 5 ] — he was buried in Mashhad .
#Text=His son , Mirza Taleb Khan Ordubadi , succeeded him as grand vizier , occupying the office till 1621 .

#Text=He was reappointed as grand vizier during the reign of shah Safi ( r. 1629 – 1642 ) from 1632 until 1633 , where he was assassinated by the eunuch Saru Taqi , due to a personal hatred he had towards the Ordubadi family , the reason being that Hatem Beg had denied to give Saru Taqi 's father a post which he had asked for . [ 1 ]
